Crimes.Crime_Name: Using a fake passport to assist in committing an indictable offence
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the revocation of Ryan's passport justified under the Canadian Passport Order and Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Canadian Passport Order; Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ryan knowingly assisted his sister with a fake passport to enter Canada, violating s.117 of the IRPA.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The decision to revoke Ryan's passport was reasonable and within the Director's jurisdiction.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the passport revocation decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; passport revocation upheld
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Ryan facilitated his sister's entry into Canada using a counterfeit passport
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged improper revocation of passport without proper jurisdiction or procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness and procedural fairness under administrative law
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Whether Ryan committed an indictable offence abroad that would be indictable in Canada
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Canadian Passport Order, s. 10(2)(b); IRPA, s. 117
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether the Director followed procedural fairness by providing disclosure and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied in judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; facts accepted based on evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence of use of fake passport and Ryan’s knowledge of its falsity
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 117; Canadian Passport Order s. 10(2)(b)
Crimes.Application_Basis: Passport used to commit an indictable offence abroad punishable in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation and circumstances surrounding the use of the fake passport
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A passport may be revoked if used to commit an indictable offence abroad that is also an indictable offence in Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; sufficient evidence supported the decision
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Director under the Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Undermining integrity of immigration and travel document system
Crimes.Cause_Description: Ryan attempted to facilitate his sister's illegal entry into Canada using a fake passport
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Disclosure provided and response allowed, satisfying procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No significant disputes over authenticity or admissibility
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – focused on entry facilitation, not status
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Use of counterfeit travel document with intent to deceive border authorities
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 117; Canadian Passport Order s. 10(2)(b)
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether the Director had authority to act based on conduct abroad
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Director reasonably assessed evidence of Ryan’s involvement
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Ryan’s actions constituted an indictable offence under Canadian law, justifying revocation
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Passport issuing authority / Director under Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness in administrative decision-making

Crimes.Crime_Name: Facilitating or aiding the entry of an improperly documented individual into Canada contrary to s. 117 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Director properly revoke Ryan's passport under the Canadian Passport Order based on his actions violating s. 117 of the IRPA?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 117; Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ryan helped his sister enter Canada with a fake passport, knowing it was counterfeit, which constitutes aiding illegal entry under s. 117 of the IRPA.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The Director's decision to revoke Ryan's passport was reasonable and procedurally fair as all requirements were met.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the passport revocation
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; passport revocation stands
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Ryan facilitated unlawful entry by providing and using a counterfeit passport for his sister
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to legality, jurisdiction, and fairness of passport revocation
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness and procedural fairness in administrative decisions
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Whether aiding entry with false documents constitutes an indictable offence under Canadian law
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA s. 117; Canadian Passport Order s. 10(2)(b)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness: right to disclosure and response
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard in judicial review of administrative action
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Factual basis accepted; no credibility concerns raised
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Details of fake passport usage and Ryan’s knowledge thereof
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 117 – aiding or abetting illegal entry
Crimes.Application_Basis: Act of assisting entry with forged document meets elements of s. 117 IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Circumstances and documentation related to border crossing attempt
Crimes.Governing_Rule: It is an offence to aid or abet the entry of a person who is not entitled to enter Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; evidence sufficient to support finding
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Director under the Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Threat to immigration control and document security
Crimes.Cause_Description: Ryan attempted to facilitate his sister's illegal entry into Canada using a counterfeit passport
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Proper disclosure and opportunity to respond ensured fairness
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – pertains to entry, not residency status
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Use of forged travel document to misrepresent identity or eligibility
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Director to act based on extraterritorial conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Director reasonably concluded Ryan committed an offence based on available evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Ryan’s conduct amounted to an indictable offence under Canadian law, justifying revocation under the Passport Order
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Passport issuing authority / Director under Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision under judicial review
